intro: Pilosella rubrobauhinii, commonly known as the red-haired mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its foliage is covered in dense, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive, fluffy appearance. Pilosella rubrobauhinii is often found in open, sunny habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
